Entry.JapaneseText: 酋長って、あんまり 聞かない言葉だね。
Entry.EnglishText: Chieftan isn't really a word you hear often.

Entry.JapaneseText: 部族の長という意味だ。この村では、 酋長の言う事は<Yellow>絶対<White>なんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: It means that he is the head of this tribe. Whatever the chieftan says is absolute in this village.

Entry.JapaneseText: この村独自のならわしで、酋長への崇拝は 長い歴史を持っている。
Entry.EnglishText: This village has a long history of venerating their chieftans, which is a custom unique to them.

Entry.JapaneseText: へえ……王様みたいなものなんだネ。
Entry.EnglishText: Wow... So I guess he's like a king.

Entry.JapaneseText: うむ、住民たちにとっては、 国王陛下と並ぶ存在と言えるだろうな。
Entry.EnglishText: Yes, you could say that to the people who live here, he is on equal standing with the ruler of The Kingdom.
